Posts.Content: I just want to say I'm thinking of you and I hope everything goes well. Nothing you ask is silly or small on here. We all have dilemmas and thinking of what we're all going through one way or another, it's a wonder we know how to get out of bed in the mornings....or afternoons, but we carry on!  Bon courage and all the best. Lizzy
Posts.Title: Practical post mastectomy stuff

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I'm just wondering what kind of surgery you've had for your lumpectomys. I had a benign lump (lipoma) removed many years ago and I could never see where the scar was, it was so discreet. On line it's possible to find images of simple scars that were the result of cancer lumpectomies.  After my diagnosis I had my lumpectomy which involved an incision wound the whole way across at the base of my breast, a vertical one up to my nipple, the nipple removed and sewn back in a different place. I'm grateful that my operation happened of course, and I was lucky enough not to need a mastectomy (as yet). The whole procedure was carried out a second time because not enough margin was taken. Did anyone else get this quite extensive cutting for their lumpectomy?  The surgeon sewed my nipple back where he saw fit but now it's much higher than the other and seems to want to poke out of the top of my bra. My nipple wasn't involved in the cancer and my lump was the lateral side of my left breast and approximately 2cm in diameter. I think of it as my lumpectomy with collateral mutilaion and wonder if I'm being dramatic or if most people's surgery was performed in a different way.  Part of my nipple was also lost in the procedure and I now have what seems like a lob sided eye peering up at me. It's obviously been cut away on one edge so there's no getting it back.  A smile to all you beautiful women xxxx
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy scars

Posts.Content: Jamiehosed, I'm so pleased for you and hope your scar is as minimal as it seems it will be. O also had my nodes removed and wasn't cut for that. Maybe the surgeon just needed room to move, but it looks like he had elbow room from what I can see now. Hahaha. hugs. Lizzy.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy scars

Posts.Content: Hey Helen, sorry you ended up with a mastectomy but it sounds like you've had reconstruction now. The kid with a squint makes me laugh. I seriously have no idea why he did what he did at all. It's as if he decided to expose the whole of my mammary tissue for some reason, which isn't necessary with all the scanning techniques etc. It wouldn't be so bad but the left nipple is about two inches higher than the right. I have a pad in my bra to make my boobs look equal size but I have to watch what I wear because the left nipple keeps crawling out of my bra at the top. If everything goes well I'm considering seeing a plastic surgeon for reconstruction, if I can afford it that is. I expect it's very expensive. I daren't let the general surgeon do any more than he has to or I might find a huge boil on my chin one day! Lol. XXX
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy scars

Posts.Content: I hope you’re ok and don’t need further surgery. I understand your worry. I had to have a second surgery as the margin they took around the tumour wasn’t enough the first time. My second surgery was a breeze compared to the first. Why did they remove your nipple? Was the cancer involved in it? My nipple wasn’t involved at all but they sliced half of it away during my first surgery, which really annoyed me, but it’s gone now so I can’t do anything about it. Good luck to you. ❤️❤️
Posts.Title: Still worried about future

Posts.Content: I hope you’re ok and don’t need further surgery. I understand your worry. I had to have a second surgery as the margin they took around the tumour wasn’t enough the first time. My second surgery was a breeze compared to the first. Why did they remove your nipple? Was the cancer involved in it? My nipple wasn’t involved at all but they sliced half of it away during my first surgery, which really annoyed me, but it’s gone now so I can’t do anything about it. Good luck to you. ❤️❤️
Posts.Title: Still worried about future

Posts.Content: I know that everyone using this site is going through, or has gone through some very though times physically, emotionally and psychologically. Most of our problems are serious to us and the slightest worry can feel enormous. This is not a serious problem, but losing my hair disturbed me a lot. There's a lighter side to it though, which actually makes me laugh now and it's my wig who deserves the title 'my dead rat'. When I think of the embarrassing times I've had with it, I can't help but laugh, like when I first wore it and was sitting down and looked up to the person shaking my hand to say hello. The angle of my head was such that my wig slid up the back of my head a good inch. The person looking at me didn't look me in the eye, but couldn't take his eyes off the top of my head. He'd obviously seen the bloody rat move to leave me looking like an egg head. I was wondering if anyone else had a wig story or two.
Posts.Title: Me and my dead rat! Has anyone had wig problems?

Posts.Content: Sally, you sooo made me laugh. I'm sorry about your permanent alopecia problem but you certainly seem to have conquered the situation with a smile and even a giggle. I'm not planning on having my problem long term, but who knows?? I hope your other half gets sorted out promptly and well, but with your sense of humour I'm sure your darling will be positive if you can help it at all! Don't worry about what you write on here and whether or not it's appropriate. Apart from the odd person that might think such subjects are flippant, most people are as sound as the proverbial pound and are truly lovely. If someone is not 'lovely', I just like to believe they're having a bad time and it's resulting in a bit of scorn. Seriously, there are so many beautiful contributors to these pages, they are all very inspirational.  I have some epic stories about my dead rat ( who I don't think is entirely deceased sometimes). I was desperate for hair once I shaved off my own at the start of FEC treatment and I started to shed. I went to buy one and the first place I visited was a wig shop that doubled as a hairdressing salon. The only mortal beings in there were the owner, and an old woman eating a sandwich (and not having her hair done) and a yapping little dog. To be continued!
Posts.Title: Me and my dead rat! Has anyone had wig problems?

Posts.Content: Certainly are horrible little things though eh?. Can't wait for the funeral pyre to commence, mind you, my hair is 2cm at most so I'll have to wait a while, lots of love, Lizzy.
Posts.Title: Me and my dead rat! Has anyone had wig problems?

Posts.Content: Kim, that's so funny. Our little hairy friends do cause some trouble don't they. My cat was scared of mine when he saw it on mu bed lol. Hugs, Lizzy. XXX
Posts.Title: Me and my dead rat! Has anyone had wig problems?

Posts.Content: I bought the best of the bad bunch, 400 euros, OMG what a rip off!! I was a fool. I never even had my head measured or anything. The woman wouldn't take anything but cash and the only time I saw her smile was when she was counting the money! Her hair looked like a German Shepards arse so I think I should have realised, but I was in a bad place. I Didn't wear the wig for ages and stayed in my cave because I was too embarrassed to go out; what an idiot I was. When i did go out I was fearful that it would ride up again so I ordered some 'wig glue' online. I glued my wig to the front and back of my head and the next day I couldn't get rid of the glue. Actually it was stuck to my skin for a week! I was peeling it off along with chunks of skin, a bit at a time. I then ordered some double sided sticky strips. Ok, maybe I said I had no hair, but in reality I had some fluffy bits. The strips held my dead rat in place for a good night out but when I came to take it off it 'waxed' away every fibre hair or fluff or I had remaining, consequently I didn't use the strips again, or the bloody glue!. I've eventually learned to live with my little rat but have had to snip it at both sides above the ears because it was actually too small and quite often decided to go for a rat zombie walk now and again and it felt like my head was in a vice! Bloody piece of shit that it is.I also had to cut bits off to make it look 'normal' around my face. My hair is growing very slowly but I WILL have a ceremony when I no longer need my little dead rat!!
Posts.Title: Me and my dead rat! Has anyone had wig problems?

Posts.Content: I’ve had a red sore nose since starting tamoxifen. I look like Rudolph. My right nostril is sore inside and also just on the outside. I’ve been a nurse all my life and I think it’s an an attack of streptococcal bacteria which is common in noses (what a weird but annoying subject this is). I bought some chloramphenicol eye ointment and used it on the sores around my right nostril. It seems to be working well but it’s hard to apply when the mucus membranes inside the nose can be so wet. If you can put chloramphenicol in your eyes, I don’t see any reason not to use it in a nostril. It’s an antibiotic that’s not used systemically as it causes all sorts of problems, but for minor external treatments it’s acceptable. I know a surgeon who always prescribes it to put on wounds after surgery to prevent infection.  Vaseline sounds effective though, probably because it restricts the spread and confines it to one area. Also immunity is suppressed while on chemo so any bug can get a grip at times. I may look like Rudolph now but I won’t be leading the reindeer as it’s going away quickly. ❤️❤️❤️
Posts.Title: Nose sores!!

Posts.Content: Dear friends every single one of you  Most people looking at and/or have contributed to this site, have been through the same shit, and we all know how terrible we've felt at times. We all know the horrors of chemo, hair loss, taste changes etc. Lets face it, it's a most dreadful and horrendous experience that we can't properly relate to ourselves let alone one another. However similar our trials have been, we each live within our own bodies and only we as individuals experience our separate lonely ride. If anyone thinks I'm being dramatic then they either haven't gone through it or have had a relatively easy ride. What I want to share with all you beautiful ladies is the most positive thing that has happened to me in many months. It's only tiny in the face of the whole picture but I'm serious when I say it's shifted my mood from the bad extreme to the best extreme. I'm joyful today. My eyelashes started to appear as little black dots after finishing FEC and starting taxotere. I still wouldn't go out because I couldn't wear makeup because of streaming eyes all of the time. I looked like a bloody alien. I finished taxotere and  still the  eyes were running for ages, I thought it would never end. Six weeks ago I finished the poison from hell and although I've had bad side effects from herceptin since, my eyes stopped running about a week ago. I was able to wear 'smoky eyes' eyeliner that disguised my lack of lashes to the most part. I'm now ecstatic to report that my eyelashes and brows are coming back  thick and fast to the point that they are annoying me because they get in the way of my eyeliner brush! I can't believe it and am totally thrilled. I've been taking Biotin and Solgar 'skin, nails and hair' supplements (all approved by oncs). My hair is also coming back nicely and my nails are stronger than they've ever been!! One small step for one woman, one great step for breast cancer sufferers!!! High as a bloody kite, even if it only lasts a day or two, its so lovely!!!! Love to all Lizzy. XXX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: We can only see the view from our individual little window, but sharing what we see and how it made us feel describes an entire world, and it's a world that only those on the same journey can relate to.
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Sammy104, LOL I tried it too. It took me at least an hour to attach a pair of falsies. Before you lose your lashes you don't realise there's a small 'ledge' left where they used to grow, not a thin straight guiding line. I ended up with glue all over my face, one eye wide open and the other half shut, I bet I looked more like a freak than I thought at the time because I was determined to go out with them on. Needless to say my weepy eyes soon washed the glue off and each eyelash was still fixed at one corner but the rest was flapping around until someone kindly told me about them. I had to whip them off quickly and was so embarrassed. Now I think it's hilarious though, but I'll never forget it. XXX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Kim, you sound amazing and I wish I could meet you with your bright pink hair! Mine came back just less than a millimeter and it was immediately dyed dark ginger. It's only about 12 mm and its been dyed twice since. Hate the fact that it's naturally bloody white now! I mean pure white, not a trace of even steel colour. I'm 60. The neck and back hair is weird but i don't know how hairy you were before. LOL. Obviously you need the help of a trained professional muscular young man to assist you with the areas you can't quite reach!! The mascara sounds great if it lengthens lashes shorter lashes. I've written it down for when mascara is even possible for me. Should be soon!!!  I have to take herceptin until next March and the side effects resemble those of taxotere to me, but without the taste changes. the positive is that they seem to disappear after about five days. My next  is Wednesday. For the past two days I've felt really good and don't want herceptin again to change my mood, but it's going to be a long haul and I have to get used it to accept it. I'm not so worried about radio because I think after Taxotere I could eat rat poison with a smile. Thanks so much for your lovely correspondence. You sound and are probably lovely, as are all our fellow comrades on this site arel .Hey, comrades is a good plural because we are fighting a war. We are all battle weary veterans now. Take pride! Lots of love, Lizzy XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: G & J Lol. Looks like the thing in that scary Japanese film 'The Grudge' XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: JMP, some lovely pinky's there. I wonder which one Kim will resemble the most!! XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Fiddlesticks, I know! Funny how the annoying hairs you spend your life trying to remove take pleasure in growing, while taking the mick out of the precious stunted hair you treasure struggles to re-emerge! ( I nearly said 'while taking the piss' but thought the moderator might not like it!) Just a biologically based cruel drama! I think the least chemo should do to us is eliminate the unwanted hair forever. That would be a fair-ish exchange! Big hugs Lizzy
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Loolyboo, I think you'll keep your eyelashes if you still have them after FEC. It's usually the FEC that strips you naked if you're going to be. I'm so pleased for you, remember to flutter them at everyone and anyone, they're very precious. Hope you're not feeling too bad in general with your chemo. I expect you're 3/4 through it now so best wishes X
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Hi Ange, I'm still at the stage when hairs are emerging so my routine for getting ready remains the baldy kind. No long sessions of washing, conditioning and blow drying hair. Makeup is a quick painting on of eyebrows and a good daub of eyeliner, bit of blusher, stick the dead rat on my head and I'm done. It takes a fraction of the time that it used to get ready. I can imagine when everything grows back properly I'll be allowing at least an hour to go through my ritual pampering again each day. I can't wait to start applying mascara again. I had long eyelashes and hope they grow as long again. Take care, with love. Lizzy.XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Great to hear from you again Kim. I say go for it. I think it's great to be different and the pink is certainly significant!! I was auburn but had started to get very grey and used to have to dye my hair anyway. It's weird about the hairiness lots of people seem to talk about. I haven't got any extra hair at all. One lady said she had it but it disappeared after a while so good luck. I am to have Herceptin every three weeks until next March followed by five years of daily tablets - not quite sure which one they will give me yet. I think I accept the side effects because because I have no choice, but I'm a right moaning cow when I get them. I'll be starting 33 sessions of radiotherapy soon so my winging will probably intensify. Lol. Yes this site is brilliant and everyone feels like a friend because we have a bond even though we've never met. I love it. Please let me know how you feel when you've had your hair done. I bet you'll love it Lots of love and hugs, Lizzy. XXXX Let
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Hey Kim, I hate the bloody dead rat. When I wear it I'm sure it's not quite all that dead after all because it creeps up the back at times and I'm sure it has little legs with sharp toe nails. I live next to a river and have made a solemn vow! As soon as I'm comfortable with the look of my hair, the little dead rat will be set adrift on a raft on the river with it's little funeral pyre blazing atop, and fireworks sending it on it's way. Maybe a glass of the fantastic local champagne equivalent, (it's called Blanquette), with my friends. I mean it, it will happen!!  The Annie Lennox look sounds great. I'm sure your grand kids will love your pink hair, I bet they will think you're sooo cool!! Love from Lizzy. XXX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: JMP the prple looks great! XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Fiona, don't despair, they are there! They hide away from taxotere! with big hugs. Lizzy. XXX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Maxine, I thought my eyes would never stop. I thought, ok, yeh, it's chemo, but when they wouldn't stop I thought I'd got blepharitis or something I would have forever. I couldn't see an end to it  OMG Courage friend, it will end and you know more than anyone how much you deserve some peace. Lots of love. Lizzy
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Kim, LOL. You made me laugh a lot. At least getting rid of unwanted hair is easier than trying to acquire hairs where we don't have them and want them!! I'm so happy for you that the chemo is in the past now and you have your lashes back. Big hugs. Lizzy. XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Hey Nicky, yes there's obviously a new species of mutated creatures moving among the human race, and we're them! At least the body-snatchers return us to humanity again eventually! I'm just using a cheap eyebrow kit. I bought more expensive ones but find the Rimmel one is the best. It comes with a tiny angled brush that makes the perfect shape. My eyebrows actually look close to real with it and it stays on very well. You may not become a bearded lady because I haven't. It sounds like we'd have too much competition in the freak show anyway because the show has already commenced with the other ladies taking starring roles, only on limited contract though! We have our own unique roles in our own freaky ways. What an experience for us all eh? At least we can laugh at ourselves after we've been systemically poisoned and emerged as weird aliens for a time. The key word to everything is 'temporary'. Love and hugs, Lizzy.
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Mandyp, Please don't worry, most people seem to get on with Herceptin much better than I do. I too had Herceptin with the taxotere and blamed all the side effects on Taxotere simply because people were saying Herceptin is much easier to cope with. It's me, I'm born to moan so I'm granted plenty of reasons to do so. Even for me though, the Herceptin side effects last for a number of days and then disappear so I's not so bad. It's just a nuisance when I've just started to get my mojo back though. I'm about to have another lot on Wednesday and I'm waiting to see how I feel afterwards. Other people have also said the symptoms fade as you get used to it. You're half way through chemo so that's brilliant. Love and hugs to help you finish. Lizzy. XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Hey Kim, I hope you had a great day golfing. I went for a bike ride earlier. A lovely lady on this site recommended R1 R2 gels for radiotherapy. One is to be applied before and the other after apparently. The lady who told me lives in Australia and had to get them sent from England. They don't have them in the pharmacies here in France though so I'll be ordering them on-line. It'd good you're learning all the medication names, it can be like another language sometimes. I'm a nurse so I'm pretty fluent. Lol. I've got some hydrocortisone actually that I nicked from work. Don't tell anyone! Love from Lizzy. XXX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Hi Judyr58, It's the cyclophosphamide that likes to strip us naked. I'm sorry you had to endure 8 Taxotere as it can be a right bitch for some people, including me of course, fueling my need to moan, ha ha.  I love your 'sisterly solidarity' and it's absolutely true isn't it? Best wishes for the rest of your treatment. XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Hey Kim, I wasn't too bad after my bike ride which surprised me a lot! Actually, speaking about my wig, I think I'll start a new thread just about that because I've had such troubles with it. lol Hopefully talk to you on that soon. I know this site is great for everyone and there are so many worried and suffering ladies (and men), I feel I just want to make a light and funny side to everything if I can.  Got herceptin today so can't start it yet. Talk soon. Love Lizzy. XXX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: tinytears71, I'm sending love and hugs. There is light at the end of the tunnel for sure. I've yet to have my radiotherapy but looking back to the beginning of chemo, it seems to have flown by really quickly XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Puzzler, I hope you've found another good mascara. These things are so personal. X
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Sammy104, I'm lucky that I don't have any extra downy type hair, I'm glad your baby fluff disappeared. Lol. Yes the mirror has been a challenge for months seeing the bald alien freak staring at me along with the lumpectomy scar and collateral mutilation. I'm getting used to it now and don't jump every time I pass a mirror. I'm waiting for the transformation to take place and be pleased to see the (not so unattractive) old gal looking back at me once more. Hugs, Lizzy. XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Fiddlesticks, yeh, purple sounds good especially for me as a big Prince fan. I have to still to dark red though because I want to look more like I used to. You should go for it though! XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Thanks Judyr58, I'll give it a try, sounds really good. XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Moominsmum, You're absolutely right, perspectives chang and little things mean a lot. You have to laugh at some stupid things too. I shaved my legs yesterday for the first time in 6 months......when I realised the hair on my legs was longer than the hair on my head! LOL XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Nix, I thought it was just my luck to get cancer and then think I'd developed Alzheimer's, until I read about chemo brain!! I quite often find myself stood gawping around me wondering what the hell I was supposed to be doing! Glad you didn't murder your faithful little car X
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Mandyp, if you still have your lashes after FEC you'll probably keep them. I'm sure you could wax your tache if you usually do anyway. It's only an external aesthetic thing so I can't see it being a problem. So you're half way through now and have the T to come, I'm sure it will fly by as it seemed to for me. Lots of love and hugs to help you on your way. It'll soon be over, all the best to you. XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Oh Kim, Can't wait to see the photo of your hair.
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Morning Kim, I can't wit for that liberating release from the rat and my little goodbye ceremony. I've noticed too that my my eyelashes and brows seem to growing at an amazing rate now - mascara is prominently placed on my dressing table ready for battle. The river Aude rises a bit in the winter but isn't very deep as it runs through my little town, Limoux. Apparently there used to be constant flooding and my house used to get it , but since they built a new dam in the Pyrenees it hasn't happened although it's best not to be too complacent I suppose. The old flood warning systems are still up around town and there's a loud speaker on the corner opposite. The system is mainly used to broadcast carols at Christmas now. The bike ride was lovely and I intend to do one as often as possible. Mind you, after 6 months of inertia I'm bloody well aching this morning. A certain discomfort reminds me I must buy a soft gel seat for my bike!! Love from Lizzy. XXX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Hey Debbie, I'm really pleased for you about your eyelashes. Isn't it remarkable that once,we probably would never have thought that 'normal' was something to aim for and be overjoyed to become. In my case I doubt that I ever was so if I actually get there after all of this it will be a nice new experience. Lol. A lot of hugs. Lizzy XX
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: No choice Papplewick but to write on here until they’ve sorted out personal messaging. ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: Hey Papplewick, lovely to hear from you. ❤️❤️ Well I’ve been off Letrozole now for about 12 weeks and am still getting joint pains, especially in my hand and wrists. I’ve been taking tamoxifen for a couple of weeks and I’m not liking it! I get hot flushes, headache and insomnia. The worst thing I’ve noticed is that about half an hour after taking it I begin to get anxiety that gets worse and worse during the day. Someone mentioned FEAR. Is that what you’re getting as well? It becomes overwhelming and debilitating.  Yes, we all know what we’ve been through and what could happen to us. Chemo, radio and the maintenance drugs can all cause another cancer! It seems like Russian roulette for all of us. I’m seeing GP on Thursday and might ask for venaflexine. I take diazepam and have reduced it from 30mg a day to just 5mg now and really don’t want to up the dose again for my anxiety. It’s great as a temporary fix for anxiety but coming off it is a nightmare I’d rather not take antidepressants as you say Papplewick because I’m alread taking more tablets than I want to including co-codamol and ibuprofen for my joints, but if I need it I might try it.  What a game this all is! It seems we have to play it and don’t have a choice but I understand anyone deciding not to take maintenance drugs. 10 bloody years of this? That one fatal day when were all diagnosed and the wheel of events following that. My goodness, what a life changing day that was! ❤️❤️❤️
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: Papplewick, I’ve been trying to send you a private message but can’t get it to work. Really stupid thing won’t let me type anything in the box. Never mind, I’ll send you my love here instead. ❤️❤️❤️
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: It’s good you’re taking a break Papplewick, but now I’ve started I feel I should continue. I still have joint pains but they are manageable with ibuprofen and co-codamol. Yes the bloody red nose appeared when I started taking tamoxifen so I looked up side effects and there it was, redness to face. Trust me to get on my nose though. Lol. Anyway, concealer works fine and it seems to be going away a bit now anyway.  It’s hard to know how to find each other on Facebook without giving our personal details in public. I’d love to keep in touch with you properly and share more detailed information together. Don’t know how we can manage it. Any ideas? ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: Dear bigguy,  Don’t worry about it because everyone is different. Some prefer to take it at night but I prefer to take it mid morning as it cuts down my night sweats. Good luck and love. ❤️❤️❤️
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: Ella ladies.  It’s good to hear someone else also had the red nose problem. I thought I’d be growing antlers next!  Keep smiling. With love. ❤️❤️❤️
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: I’ve only been taking taking tamoxifen for a few days. I’m getting overwhelming anxiety, difficulties in sleeping  bone and muscle pains. I. Feel desperateand once again (after Letrozole) feel like I’m 100 years old. Do the side effects calm down after a while. I can’t take it for ten years if I feel like this the whole time!  Your suggestions please. ❤️❤️❤️
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: Hi Macmillan. I understand why you don’t allow disclosure of personal info. Your private messaging system is not working at the moment. Could you please look into this? Many thanks.
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: Yes I think naproxen might help me. I’m supposed to take tamoxifen for 10 years and I can’t put up with the joint pain until then. The hot flushes and night sweats seem to be lessened since I started taking it in the morning instead of at night. Tryptophan, I’m not offended at all but quite flattered. I do a lot of writing just for myself anyway, it helps me offload. I might look in to your suggestion. ❤️❤️❤️
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: Lol was predicted text. I meant tryptos. ❤️
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: Another thing. I’ve looked at side effects of tamoxifen and it does day you can get redness of the face. Since starting it my nose is red and shiny, I look like Rudolph. I already feel like a freak, but this is so noticeable! Anyone else had this problem? ❤️❤️❤️
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: Dear Callirose, I feel we are all in this together. We choose to take meds’ or refuse them, it’s our individual choice. Best of luck. Lots of love to you. ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: Thanks so much. I’m seeing my gp next week and will ask for venaflexine. As it’s an antidepressant it might help lift my mood too. I’ll continue with tamoxifen and hope the doctor will give me the venaflexine as the hot flushes are horrible. Thanks for your help. ❤️❤️
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: *venaflaxine. I think that’s what you mean. I will ask about it next week, thank you so much. ❤️
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: What a heartwarming post. I feel in limbo at the moment but you give me hope of rekindling my life and getting on with it after all the moping. Thank you. ❤️❤️❤️
Posts.Title: Popping in to say hello

Posts.Content: Dear jojo4. I was diagnosed over 2 years ago and went through the usual lot. I thought I was hating every minute of my treatment but at least it gave me a purpose and appointments to keep. It was when the treatment stopped and I was just put on maintenance meds that I felt I had fallen of a cliff edge. I sank into depression with anxiety as well and have been struggling up and down since then. You have given me hope that maybe soon I’ll find a purpose, like going back to work or doing something else meaningful. Thank you. ❤️❤️❤️
Posts.Title: Popping in to say hello

Posts.Content: Hey there positive person, I think that any temporary hair colour is 'fleeting', rather than temporary. I'd go for permanent if your hair is now grey. Mine is, and although it's only about 2cm long now, I've had to touch up my roots twice with colour LOL. It's now my personal joke, "my roots need doing" LOL. All the best for your pink hair. Hugs, Lizzy XX
Posts.Title: Colouring Hair
